medical_history.chief_complaint: The patient presented with fever and subsequent neurological symptoms including leg weakness and diplopia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 19 days after the third cycle of chemotherapy, with a fever of 39.3 °C. The patient remained febrile (temperature, 39 °C to 40 °C) for 5 days before reporting leg weakness and diplopia on day 5. By day 6, he was drowsy and unable to ambulate, developing a coarse tremor. On day 7, he exhibited dysphagia and dysarthria and was admitted to the intensive care unit. He required intubation for airway protection on day 8 and developed status epilepticus on day 14. Despite treatment, no improvement was noted, and on day 23 the PCR for West Nile virus in the cerebrospinal fluid was negative for the first time.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had a history of refractory chronic lymphocytic leukemia and had undergone chemotherapy treatment.
medical_history.social_history: The patient had numerous mosquito bites during the previous weeks prior to admission.
